leitej.xml.om

Class XmlomIOStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • leitej.xml.om.XmlomIOStream

  • public final class XmlomIOStream
extends java.lang.Object
    An useful class to help in XML Object Modelling stream.
    Author:
    Julio Leite
    See Also:
    XmlomOutputStream, XmlomInputStream

      • sendToFileUTF8

        public static <I extends XmlObjectModelling> void sendToFileUTF8(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                                 I obj)
                                                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                                 java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                                 java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                                 java.io.IOException
        Saves the object to a file with the Constant.UTF8_CHARSET_NAME.
        This method will try to create the file if not exists.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a pathname string
        obj - object to be saved
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the filename argument is null
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method does not permit verification of the existence of the named directory and all necessary parent directories; or if the checkWrite method does not permit the named directory and all necessary parent directories to be created; or if a security manager exists and its checkWrite method denies write access to the file

                                                                 java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                                 java.io.IOException

        This method will try to create the file if not exists.

        fileName - a pathname string
        objs - objects to be saved
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the filename argument is null
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred

      • sendToFile

        public static <I extends XmlObjectModelling> void sendToFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                             java.lang.String charsetName,
                                                             boolean minified,
                                                             I[] objs)
                                                      throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                                             java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                             java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                             java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                             java.io.IOException
        Saves the objects to a file.
        This method will try to create the file if not exists.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a pathname string
        charsetName - name of a supported charset @param minified when false produces a human readable XML, other wise outputs a clean strait line @param objs objects to be saved @throws FileNotFoundException If the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the filename argument is null
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method does not permit verification of the existence of the named directory and all necessary parent directories; or if the checkWrite method does not permit the named directory and all necessary parent directories to be created; or if a security manager exists and its checkWrite method denies write access to the file
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the named encoding is not supported
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • sendToFile

        public static <I extends XmlObjectModelling> void sendToFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                             java.lang.String charsetName,
                                                             boolean minified,
                                                             I obj)
                                                      throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                                             java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                             java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                             java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                             java.io.IOException
        Saves the object to a file.
        This method will try to create the file if not exists.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a pathname string
        charsetName - name of a supported charset @param minified when false produces a human readable XML, other wise outputs a clean strait line @param obj object to be saved @throws FileNotFoundException If the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the filename argument is null
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method does not permit verification of the existence of the named directory and all necessary parent directories; or if the checkWrite method does not permit the named directory and all necessary parent directories to be created; or if a security manager exists and its checkWrite method denies write access to the file
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the named encoding is not supported
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • sendToStreamUTF8

        public static <I extends XmlObjectModelling> void sendToStreamUTF8(java.io.OutputStream os,
                                                                   boolean minified,
                                                                   I[] objs)
                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the objs to the stream with the Constant.UTF8_CHARSET_NAME. And don't closes it.
        Parameters:
        os - an OutputStream
        minified - when false produces a human readable XML, other wise outputs a clean strait line
        objs - to write to the stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • sendToStream

        public static <I extends XmlObjectModelling> void sendToStream(java.io.OutputStream os,
                                                               java.lang.String charsetName,
                                                               boolean minified,
                                                               I[] objs)
                                                        throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                                               java.io.IOException
        Writes the objs to the stream. And don't closes it.
        Parameters:
        os - an OutputStream
        charsetName - the name of a supported charset
        minified - when false produces a human readable XML, other wise outputs a clean strait line
        objs - to write to the stream
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the named encoding is not supported
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • getObjectsFromFileUTF8

        public static <I extends XmlObjectModelling> java.util.List<I> getObjectsFromFileUTF8(java.lang.Class<I> interfaceClass,
                                                                                      java.lang.String fileName)
                                                                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                                                      java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                                                      java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                                                      XmlInvalidLtException,
                                                                                      java.io.IOException
        Reads all objects from the file in Constant.UTF8_CHARSET_NAME.
        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - type of object to be ridden
        fileName - a pathname string
        Returns:
        all the ridden objects
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the pathname argument is null; or if trustClass has a class null
        XmlInvalidLtException - If is reading a corrupted XML
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • getObjectsFromFile

        public static <I extends XmlObjectModelling> java.util.List<I> getObjectsFromFile(java.lang.Class<I> interfaceClass,
                                                                                  java.lang.String fileName,
                                                                                  java.lang.String charsetName)
                                                                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                                                  java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                                                  java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                                                                  java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                                                  XmlInvalidLtException,
                                                                                  java.io.IOException
        Reads all objects from the file.
        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - type of object to be ridden
        fileName - a pathname string
        charsetName - the name of a supported charset
        Returns:
        all the ridden objects
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file.
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the named charset is not supported
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the pathname argument is null; or if trustClass has a class null
        XmlInvalidLtException - If is reading a corrupted XML
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
